page.title: 07SALMON FISHING, CARNOUSTIE
page.content: The small village of{Easthaven} is where Mr.Duncan, a full-time{salmon {fisherman}lives and works. He has the sole salmon-fishing rights of the stretch of water between{Carnoustie} and{Elliot}and leases them from the {Tay Salmon Fishing Company}to whom he must sell his fish. He uses two kinds of nets---staked nets and floating nets, which cost Â£500 each. Mr.Duncan must go to his nets every 12hrs. to remove any {salmon.} Sometimes he finds{seals}in his net and on one occasion he found a {25ft. basking shark.} This means a great deal of extra work for Mr.Duncan as they cause damage to his nets. It is illegal for anyone but Mr.Duncan to catch salmon in this area and regular patrols are made along the coast by aircraft to spot salmon poachers who will be heavily fined.
